docs.lead_paragraph: New York City has launched its municipal identification card program, the largest in the country, which officials say will allow immigrants living in the country illegally to access key city services they were previously unable to obtain.

headline.main: New York City Launches Municipal Identification Card Program
headline.print_headline: New York City Launches Municipal Identification Card Program

docs.snippet: New York City has launched its municipal identification card program, the largest in the country, which officials say will allow immigrants living in the country illegally to access key city services they were previously unable to obtain.

docs.lead_paragraph: If you're among the millions of consumers who got financial help for health insurance last year under President Barack Obama's law, better keep an eye on your mailbox.

docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. Supreme Court on Monday declined to take up another broad challenge to President Barack Obama's signature healthcare law.

headline.main: Supreme Court Rejects New Challenge to Obamacare Law
headline.print_headline: Supreme Court Rejects New Challenge to Obamacare Law

docs.snippet: The U.S. Supreme Court on Monday declined to take up another broad challenge to President Barack Obama's signature healthcare law.

docs.abstract: President Obama is under fire by conservatives because he did not attend the antiterrorism unity march in Paris.
docs.snippet: President Obama is under fire by conservatives because he did not attend the antiterrorism unity march in Paris.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration has laid out detailed requirements to discourage nonprofit hospitals from using aggressive methods to collect payments from low-income patients.

headline.main: New Rules to Limit Tactics on Hospitals’ Fee Collections
headline.print_headline: Rules Will Limit Tactics on Hospitals’ Fee Collections

docs.abstract: Rules issued by Treasury Dept and IRS at end of 2014 require, if nonprofit hospital wants to retain or attain tax-exempt status, it must offer some assistance to needy patients and refrain from using aggressive tactics to get low-income patients to pay hospital bills; rules are backed by Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, which raises possibility that they could influence behavior of for-profit hospitals.
docs.snippet: The Obama administration has laid out detailed requirements to discourage nonprofit hospitals from using aggressive methods to collect payments from low-income patients.

docs.lead_paragraph: When newly-wed Kamlesh was told she would be accompanying her husband to work in the city, she was thrilled at the prospect of a better life than in the drought-prone village in central India where she grew up.

headline.main: Building India's Cities, Silent Workforce of Women Goes Unrecognized
headline.print_headline: Building India's Cities, Silent Workforce of Women Goes Unrecognized

docs.snippet: When newly-wed Kamlesh was told she would be accompanying her husband to work in the city, she was thrilled at the prospect of a better life than in the drought-prone village in central India where she grew up.

docs.lead_paragraph: It's not just about how many steps you've taken or how many calories you've burned in a day. Wearable fitness trackers and health monitors are becoming more commonplace and diverse, but just what do you do with all of that data?

headline.main: Wearable Sensors Gather Lots of Data _ Now to Make It Useful
headline.print_headline: Wearable Sensors Gather Lots of Data _ Now to Make It Useful

docs.lead_paragraph: The critically ill want access to experimental drugs not yet approved by the Food and Drug Administration.

headline.main: Patients Seek ‘Right to Try’ New Drugs
headline.print_headline: Patients Seek ‘Right to Try’ New Drugs

docs.abstract: Several states have passed Right to Try laws, which allow critically ill patients right to try medications that have not been approved by Food and Drug Administration; some physicians oppose laws, saying they and experimental drugs are more likely to harm than help critically ill patients.
docs.snippet: The critically ill want access to experimental drugs not yet approved by the Food and Drug Administration.
